Ingredients: Pistachios and almonds (or some other nuts)
Instructions: Wash and peel the carrots, then shred them. The outer part of a carrot is woodier, so peeling them makes them more tender. Shredding them finely will take longer but result in a nicer texture. Simmer carrots on low heat with ghee, condensed milk, and cardamom until the mixture is soft and any liquid at the bottom has evaporated or incorporated. Once that liquid is nearly gone, you will need to stir constantly to prevent sticking and burning. Shell pistachios, crush them and the almonds finely, and toast the nuts in a pan. Once the carrots are nearly done cooking, mix in the nuts and raisins.
Notes: This can be a lot of work, especially if you are shelling the cardamom and pistashios and shredding the carrots by hand. Since those tasks can all be done at the same time, this dish is great to make with your friends or family.
